column2: The Consultant is a Learning and Development professional who analyzes, designs, develops, implements, and evaluates tools and technologies to close performance gaps and drive business results by providing a best-in-class learning experience     Additionally, the Learning Consultant facilitates programs to deliver content to audiences including staff members and entry level employees           Duties and responsibilities, as they align to Ryan s Key Results         People:         Designs custom training modules and learning solutions to meet business needs that are aligned to the competencies, skill development, and the strategic direction of the Firm.      Facilitates learning activities utilizing the most effective training delivery including Instructor-led training, recorded training, live web-based training, videoconferencing, etc, and adapting their delivery style to drive audience engagement.             Client:         Develops and maintains trusted client relationships and participates in strategic consultation sessions with subject matter experts, leaders, and employees to identify gaps and assess learning and development needs.     Responds to learning and development related questions from employees and guides them to applicable training or resource solutions.     Consults with business partners and HR leaders             Value:          Uses data to identify talent and skill needs, measure success of solutions, and quantify business outcomes.     Develops and improves training programs and materials, including participant guides, facilitator guides, activities, and assessments.     Serves as the program owner for courses or programs, as assigned, including designing, piloting, scheduling, promoting, reviewing, revising, and evaluating training programs.     Monitors and reports the effectiveness of training programs through audits of specific courses and curriculum. Tracks and reports relevant metrics to demonstrate results and return on investment.     Researches, evaluates, and recommends emerging and current trends in learning and technology for application to support business objectives.     Demonstrates proficient presentation and facilitation skills.      Exhibits excellent communication and influencing skills and demonstrates listening and judgment skills when interacting with others.     Demonstrates solid public speaking skills by presenting clearly, concisely, and effectively to groups, with appropriate planning and preparation of content.     Explains concepts clearly and accurately both verbally and in writing.     Exhibits strong coaching and professional development skills.     Implements solutions with a sense of urgency and builds trust with others by delivering on commitments.     Works independently or collaboratively as part of a team to deliver results in a fast-paced environment.     Possesses project management skills.      Exhibits problem solving skills using creativity, innovation, and a solutions-focused attitude.     Demonstrates organizational skills and attention to detail; prioritizes multiple tasks and programs and completes them under time constraints.     Maintains a professional and positive attitude.     Performs other duties as assigned.             Education and Experience:           Bachelor s degree from a four-year college or university in relevant field required.                 Computer Skills:               To perform this job successfully, an individual must have intermediate to advanced skills in Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, and Internet navigation and research       Experience delivering training via online meeting technology preferred     Experience with eLearning authoring tools a plus           Certificates and Licenses:              Valid driver s license required.                 Supervisory Responsibilities:             This job has no supervisory responsibilities.                 Working Environment and Physical Demands:           Standard indoor working environment.     Occasional long periods of sitting while working at computer.     Occasional requirements to work in early morning or late in the evening to support programs for the global audience.     Occasional long periods of standing while coordinating or facilitating training..     Position requires regular interaction with employees and vendors via email, telephone, in-person meetings, group training sessions, video conferencing, and live online Web-based meeting applications.     Independent travel requirement: less than 10%.

column2: Job Summary:  As a Consultant for Overseas Education, you will be responsible for guiding students and their families through the process of applying to universities and colleges abroad. Your primary objective will be to provide comprehensive guidance and support to students in India who aspire to pursue higher education opportunities overseas. You will assist them in selecting suitable academic programs, preparing application materials, navigating admission procedures, and understanding visa requirements. Additionally, you will stay updated on international education trends, admission policies, and visa regulations to offer accurate and timely advice to clients. Responsibilities: Consult with students and their families to understand their academic goals, preferences, and financial constraints. Provide personalized guidance on selecting appropriate universities, colleges, and academic programs based on students' interests, qualifications, and career aspirations. Assist students in preparing application materials, including resumes, essays, letters of recommendation, and personal statements. Conduct workshops and seminars to educate students about various aspects of studying abroad, such as standardized testing (e.g., GRE, TOEFL, IELTS), admission requirements, and scholarship opportunities. Coordinate with international universities, admissions offices, and educational institutions to stay updated on their programs, admission criteria, and deadlines. Advise students on visa procedures, documentation, and interview preparation to facilitate smooth visa application processes. Maintain accurate records of student interactions, applications, and admissions outcomes. Collaborate with other team members to enhance service offerings and improve the overall customer experience. Stay informed about global education trends, political developments, and regulatory changes that may impact overseas study opportunities. Attend professional development workshops, conferences, and networking events to expand knowledge and expertise in the field of international education consulting. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as education, counseling, international relations, or a related discipline. A master's degree is preferred. Proven experience in education consulting, student advising, or related fields, preferably in the context of overseas education. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build rapport and establish trust with students and families from diverse cultural backgrounds. Strong organizational skills and attention to detail, with the ability to manage multiple tasks and deadlines effectively. Knowledge of international higher education systems, admission processes, and visa regulations, particularly in popular study destinations such as the United States, the United Kingdom, Canada, Australia, and New Zealand. Familiarity with standardized testing requirements (e.g., GRE, TOEFL, IELTS) and proficiency in advising students on test preparation strategies is advantageous. Proficiency in English language proficiency is essential, and proficiency in additional languages may be beneficial, particularly for serving clients from non-English-speaking backgrounds. Ethical and professional conduct, with a commitment to providing unbiased advice and support to students throughout the application process. Job Types: Full-time, Permanent Pay: 25,000.00 - 50,000.00 per month
column11: Overseas Education, Communication Skills, Presentation Skills, Ethics, Visa Processing, Organization Skills, Visa Counselling, Advisory, Interpersonal Skills

column2: SalaryRole & responsibilities   This is a full-time on-site role as an Admissions Officer located in Surat. As an Admissions Officer, you will be responsible for assisting students in the admissions process for New Zealand educational institutions. You will guide students through the application process, provide information on the programs and courses offered, and ensure a smooth transition for students from India to New Zealand.  Assist students with university and course selection, guidance on scholarships, profile building, financing options and determine the interest, aptitude, and abilities and help guide them on the visa processes for key countries.  Filling out admission application forms and submitting the complete application to the foreign university.  Coordinating with foreign universities and admissions department for student offer letter or any other admission related enquiries.  Effectively communicating the admission requirements with students, associate partners and universites.  Setting rigorous follow up mechanisms with students and the universities abroad.  Setting new benchmarks in student experiences and services.  We are changing the way study abroad counselling is conducted, by being digital.  Embrace technology to provide real-time, high quality counselling services with the latest information at your fingertips.  Be there for students on a daily basis to ensure their concerns are addressed and follow up with universities and internal teams to ensure their application process runs smoothly  Help the clients in making a list of all documents needed while submitting their applications.  Help the clients with SOP Analysis and Improvements, Assistance for LORs, Resume editing, and Financial Documentation Support.  Manage internal support teams to ensure the overall student experience is off the highest quality and all timelines are met  Identify, develop and implement strategies to achieve sales objectives for the offices for student placement. Monitor results and initiate corrective action where required. Guide students every step of their journey to discovering their dream university and program. Preferred candidate profile   Bachelor's or equivalent degree Industry knowledge. Preferably working in sector or having prior experience in student placement sector. Experience in developing business plans, budgets and skills to monitor, review and report on progress. 2+ years of proven ability to motivate and lead a team to achieve demonstrable outcomes. 1-5 years counselling experience preferably in the education industry. Strong problem resolution skills. Experience in working with CRM systems will be desirable. Respects diversity in employees. Good written and verbal English skills. Salary As per industry standards and hike on previous CTC.
column11: Student Recruiting, Admissions Counseling, Attention to Detail, Communication, Interpersonal Skills, Admissions, Multitasking, Teamwork

column2: Role:  Placement Associate - Jobs for Women, Josh Talks Location:  Gurugram, Haryana  Required Experience : 2+ Years  About the Role We are seeking a dedicated Placement Associate to join our Jobs for Women program team. The Placement Associate will play a pivotal role in facilitating job placements for program participants, building relationships with employers and industry partners, and ensuring the success of our program. About Us Josh is on a mission to unlock human potential by creating tools that effectively nurture each individuals potential. We started out in 2015, giving Bharats youth access to relatable role models in regional languages through the Josh Talks platform. As the next step, we expanded to provide affordable, employability-enhancing skills through our Android application, Josh Skills. Our flagship offering, the Spoken English course, has generated strong user feedback with industry-leading course completion rates, unlocking employment opportunities for our users.  As of January 2024, our content has accumulated over 3.32 billion lifetime views, averaging 110 million monthly views across platforms. Josh Skills has more than 9 million downloads with 435,000 paid users. To find out more information about our work, visit joshtalks.com. Role & Responsibilities: Relationship Building: Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with potential employers, recruitment agencies, and industry partners to create a robust network of job placement opportunities. Placement Coordination: Coordinate all aspects of the placement process, including scheduling interviews, facilitating communication between candidates and employers, and tracking candidate progress. Job Matching: Utilize database and job portals to match program participants with suitable job opportunities based on their skills, preferences, and qualifications. Candidate Support: Provide personalized support to program participants throughout the job search process, including resume building, interview preparation, and job application assistance. Program Promotion: Collaborate with the internal teams to promote the program to potential employers and recruit new partners for job placement opportunities. Data Management: Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of candidate profiles, job openings, and placement outcomes to track program effectiveness and support reporting requirements. Performance Monitoring: Monitor and evaluate placement outcomes to identify trends, successes, and areas for improvement, and implement strategies to optimise placement success rates. Feedback Collection: Gather feedback from both candidates and employers to identify strengths and weaknesses in the placement process and make adjustments accordingly. Training and Development: Stay informed about industry trends, job market demands, and best practices in job placement to improve placement strategies and support services continuously. Program Enhancement: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities for program enhancements, such as additional training modules or support services, to better meet the needs of program participants. Requirements: Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., business, human resources, social sciences). 2-5 years of experience in a similar role, preferably in job placement, recruitment, or career services. Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build rapport and trust with diverse stakeholders. Excellent organizational and time management abilities, with a keen attention to detail. Problem-solving skills and the ability to adapt quickly to changing priorities and circumstances. Proficiency in data management systems and tools for tracking placement progress and generating reports. Commitment to the mission and values of the Jobs for Women program, with a passion for empowering women through access to meaningful employment opportunities. Culture:  The Josh core team is composed of people who are ambitious and intend to create something that is bigger than themselves. Things that will last forever and will go on to impact and change the world. We have big dreams that are backed by our relentless pursuit to achieve them.  Awards & Recognition  Forbes India 2020:  Most Powerful Self-Made Women  National Media Award 2019:  President of India  Forbes 30 Under 30 Asia:  Media & Marketing  In the Media  Forbes India :  http://www.forbesindia.com/article/self-made-women-2020/supriya-paul-walking-the-talk/58075/1  BusinessInsider :  https://www.businessinsider.in/business/news/hasura-raises-usd-9-9-mn-funding-from-vertex-ventures-us-others/ar ticleshow/74324024.cms  Fortune India:   https://www.fortuneindia.com/macro/india-inc-reacts-to-budget-2020/104067  Economic Times:  https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/small-biz/startups/newsbuzz/new-energy-1-5-million-pre-series-a-round-to-help-josh-talks-go-international/articleshow/74334163.cms  The Hindu:  https://www.thehindu.com/society/skilled-for-life-with-josh-talks-and-nsdc/article30024016.ece  Economic Times:  https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/why-josh-talks-has-the-energy-to-be-bigger-better-than-ted-talks/articleshow/ 55936596.cms Other Details We actively seek teammates from diverse backgrounds and only hire extremely driven people. The Josh core team is composed of people who are ambitious and intend to create something that is bigger than themselves. Things that will last forever and will go on to impact and change the world. We have big dreams that are backed by our relentless pursuit to achieve them. We like no-nonsense, get stuff done kind of people and keep things simple. ================================================================== Josh Talks is proud to provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all team members and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. We also provide reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities in accordance with applicable laws.

column2: In Zebra , HRSC Representative II is responsible for providing answers to employees by using excellent, in-depth knowledge of company benefits, HR policies, procedures and programs as well as communicating effectively with team members within the HR Service Center.        Responsibilities:          Serve as a first point-of-contact for current and former employees questions on HR policies and/or processes      Maintain working knowledge of HR processes to answer customers questions      Receive inbound calls from employees through HR Service Center phone line as well as emails through shared HR Service Center inbox      Provide timely and accurate information to employees by clarifying issues, researching answers, and escalating unresolved problems      Alerts Senior HR Service Members when there is confusion or absence of information in the HRIS system to answer particular questions      Works closely with the payroll department and subject matter experts in HR to resolve employee problems      Follow through to ensure that each case is fully resolved      Utilizes the different HR systems such as ADP, Oracle Cloud, Degreed to answer employee questions      Documents all emails, calls, and walk-ups in real-time within the HR Service Center s case management software application      Pro-actively identify opportunities for processes, policies and procedures improvements and engage with Senior HR Service Members to drive the appropriate changes      Maintain employee records (both manually and electronically), acting as a system administrator for the HR system. This will include ensuring accurate data is entered and maintained in the system, performing data audits and running regular and ad hoc reports in line with business requirements      Manage key HR processes, including starter and leaver processes and contractual amendments e.g. remuneration changes and prepare required documentation.      Assist HR team members and line managers in preparing offer letters, co-coordinating acceptances, tracking key activities and managing the onboarding process      Provide rewards administration support for some company benefits programs.      Accurate and timely employee payroll data preparation for the required pay frequency (i.e. weekly, bi-weekly, monthly)      Provide internal / external audit support, e.g. collection and preparation of supporting documents      Drive consistent content management across the HR Function on the various internal tools (e.g. zConnect, ZEN, sharepoint, etc.)      Performs all work in accordance with established HR Service Center standards.      Performs related work as assigned          Qualifications:          Requires a HS diploma or GED; Associate s degree a plus      Minimum 2 year of previous experience in an automated customer service environment. Call center and benefits experience preferred      Excellent verbal and written communication skills      Team player      Excellent listening skills and the ability to ask probing questions, understand concerns, and overcome objections      Must possess a professional and friendly attitude and be able to develop a rapport with employees via email, over the phone and in person      Ability to independently execute an action plan following documented policies and procedures      Able to effectively manage multiple priorities and adapt to change within a fast-paced business environment      Ability to assess employee issues and apply the appropriate procedure, policy or define the appropriate escalation points      Ability to learn and navigate new software quickly      English compulsory and other languages a plus

column2: We are looking for a skilled and committed Legal Associate to join our Securities Law Advisory team at Corporate Professionals (CP).          In this role, your responsibilities will extend to providing legal advice on investigations launched by Regulatory Authority/Stock Exchange(s), preparing strategy as well as replies/representation to Notices/Summons issued by Regulatory Authority/Stock Exchange(s), researching for and drafting of pleadings and representations, appearing before various Authorities/Courts/Tribunals.          Other responsibilities include preparing Settlement Applications, Intermediaries Registration, preparing Legal Opinions, conducting in-depth research and staying updated.          The role involves a multifaceted approach to ensure effective resolution and advocacy on behalf of our clients.              Job Responsibilities          Offering legal advisory to clients on investigations, inspections, and enquiries by SEBI and Stock Exchanges regarding potential regulatory issues under various SEBI regulations and regulatory issues faced by Intermediaries registered with SEBI.      Preparing strategic replies/responses to notices/summons issued by SEBI/Stock Exchanges/Courts/Tribunals, etc., and representing clients before these authorities.      Liaisoning with the above-mentioned authorities in the interest of the clients.      Drafting and filing appeals, rejoinders, written submissions, legal opinions, advisory notes, settlement applications, informal guidance and exemption applications.      Advising and implementing the procedures for setting up intermediaries under various SEBI regulations and conducting compliance audits for the intermediaries.      Drafting informative and relevant legal content on behalf of the firmSecurities Law Advisory practice.      Conducting thorough and in-depth research for the responsibilities mentioned above.      Implementing and maintaining efficient case management systems and repositories to track and organize legal proceedings, ensuring compliance with deadlines and court/tribunal requirements.        Qualifications and Skills          Bachelordegree in law      AIBE Qualified and registered with the Bar Council of India      PQE of 2-3 years in a legal or consulting firm, preferably with prior experience in Securities Law      Strong drafting, research, and verbal communication skills      Good command of Corporate and Securities laws      Strong Interpretation and Research skills      Good Microsoft Office skills (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)      Ability to handle multiple clients/assignments      Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and meet deadlines      Strong networking and interpersonal skills

SAP OTC (SD) At least 6-plus years of SAP working experience in high tech manufacturing/OEM or Consumer product environment Specialized in SAP technical, functional and business experience in order-to-cash, e-commerce B2B / B2C and CRM.      Deep business & working experience in OTC Extensive business knowledge of sales fulfilment business processes consumer, digital media and payment processing.      Extensive global and international project experience, Certified SAP R/3 or ECC 6.0 configurator with extensive & deep-knowledge of SAP R/3, ECC 6.0      Certified SAP CRM/Configurator.      Exposure to SAP Advanced Planning, GTS, EAI, BPM, Hanna is desirable.      Basic ABAP Debugging Skills Experienced in building interfaces with external systems from SAP using leading-edge technology.      Get to the heart of customer issues, diagnose problem areas, design innovative solutions and facilitate deployment resulting in client delight.      Lead small projects.      Contribute to unit-level and organizational initiatives.      Adherence to the organizational guidelines and processes Technical and Professional Requirements-      Should have Min 5 years of experience      Should be good in communication with the ability to understand business processes and translate the same into SAP Solution      Must have strong SAP Standard configuration knowledge and good SAP project process knowledge      Must be strong in Order-to-Cash processes, pricing and billing and delivery processing      Must have participated in providing designs for RICEFW elements      Should be experienced in an EDI environment; iDoc processing      Should be a good team player      Location of posting is driven by business requirements
column11: Digital media, SAP, Payment processing, SAP CRM, Debugging, Billing, GTS, EDI, ABAP, OTC

column2: We are looking for an Education Counsellor, who should be;                                        Assessing the students applications on the basis of their qualification and eligibility.                                          Coordinating with the clients/students to collect their documents, and check the authenticity of their documents, convert them into a folder.                                          Supporting and guiding the students throughout their admission process by taking their queries.                                          Tell them about the entry level requirements of colleges and universities in order to complete the admission form smoothly.                                          Preparing and presenting the applicants reports to the concerned International Universities timely.                                          Maintaining regular communication with students, parents and abroad universities for coordinating admission activities and resolving problems if any.                                          Building broad knowledge on the admission activities and guidelines of colleges. Regular follow up with Universities Colleges and Universities about the status of student's applications.                                          Desired Candidate Profile:                                              Outstanding oral and written communication in English language.                                          Proficient in Computer skills such as - MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).                                          Assist with phone calls and emails from client.                                          Ensure that record keeping, and reporting requirements are maintained.                                          Understands meaning of good customer service.                                          Good interpersonal skills.                                          Keen to learn new skills within the team.

column2: As our new Technical instructor, you will help to improve the skills of hundreds of seafarers worldwide           Have an understanding of 2-stroke engine technology             Thrives in presenting and has experience in communicating advanced technical knowledge.             Have a maritime technical background, possibly as a machinist, dual officer, or superintendent.             Fluent in English, both written and spoken             Passionate about putting your skills to use.             As an Instructor at the Academies you will be part of a team of super-talented employees who, among other things, includes highly specialized and technical instructors a digital learning consultant and administrative staff in an international environment.             Your daily work will primarily be at MAN PrimeServ office Mumbai and at Anglo Eastern Training Centre in Mumbai. However, you will also have to travel to the Academy in Denmark and other Academies in the world when required. You will refer to the head of Academies in Denmark and the Head of PrimeServ Marine Power in India.             Your primary task will be to teach (physically and online) as we'll as supporting our local partner Anglo Eastern Training Centre; Mumbai in operating our online simulator platform. The focus will primarily be on the engines, rapidly developing with different fuel types, significantly reducing CO2 emissions. The material is used for online and face-to-face teaching in our academies worldwide.              The course participants are our customers employees. You will meet engineers, technical staff, and other employees from shipping companies who are going to learn all about our 2-stroke engines. Thus, you will feel how your work contributes to making course participants and companies more knowledgeable about our products so that they can operate and ensure optimal utilization of the engines.            You can help us with these qualifications:                Degree in Marine / Mechanical Engineering.
column11: Training, Compliance, Administration Staff, Maritime, Instructor, Technical Instructor, Technical Staff, Mechanical engineering

column2: The Work Visa Counselor is responsible for advising and assisting clients in obtaining work visas for different countries, depending on the clients needs and requirements. The role involves understanding the regulations and procedures for work visas, guiding clients through the application process, and ensuring compliance with immigration laws. The ideal candidate should have strong communication skills, a client-centric approach, and a thorough understanding of immigration regulations related to work visas.                               Bachelors degree in a relevant field (e.g., Law, Business Administration, International Relations).     2+ years of experience in immigration consultancy, work visa processing, or a related field.     Strong knowledge of work visa programs and immigration procedures in various countries.     Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.     Ability to manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines.     Strong organizational and problem-solving abilities.
column11: Business administration, Interpersonal skills, Visa Counsellor, Compliance, Relationship, Consultancy, Visa processing, Management

column2: Job description Role & responsibilities Overall responsibility for taking enquiries, conversions and supervising the visas for allotted countries . Meeting the sales targets allocated for the respective countries. Reporting to Country manager & V.P. for marketing activities/admin/HR, and Country Manager at HO for training etc. Following up self-database for allotted country/countries. Follow- up enquiries collected by marketing team to convert them into walk-ins for the respective countries. Following up for tuition fee drafts, incomplete documents with students and ensuring that applications and visas are processed on time. Assisting and participating in education fairs and events - ensuring conversions from the road show walk-in data. Participating in all in-house delegate visits, ensuring quality follow-ups to generate walk-ins and providing feedback to the training department post visit, school/college visits for all marketing activities. Supervising the documentation for your respective students and making SOPs for visa, if required. Assisting and coordinating with admissions and visa team in HO for verifications and interview preparation (if required). Ensuring positive visa outcomes. Travel to other locations during events for training, road shows and sales support the other offices is mandatory as per requirement.
